title: The Great Gatsby
author: F. Scott Fitzgerald
reviews: A timeless classic that captures the essence of the Jazz Age.
Fitzgerald's prose is elegant and captivating.
details: A tale of wealth, love, and disillusionment in 1920s America. An American classic.

title: To Kill a Mockingbird
author: Harper Lee
reviews: A powerful and thought-provoking novel about racial injustice.
Scout's perspective provides a unique insight into the story.
details: A story of racial inequality and moral heroism in 1930s Alabama. A literary masterpiece.

author: George Orwell
reviews: A chilling and prophetic depiction of a totalitarian society.
Orwell's concepts of Big Brother and Newspeak are hauntingly relevant.
details: A dystopian novel depicting a society controlled by surveillance and propaganda.

title: Pride and Prejudice
author: Jane Austen
reviews: A delightful and witty novel with memorable characters.
Austen's exploration of societal norms is still engaging today.
details: A classic love story featuring social class, manners, and the search for true love.

title: The Catcher in the Rye
author: J.D. Salinger
reviews: Holden Caulfield's voice is authentic and captures the angst of adolescence.
Salinger's portrayal of alienation resonates with readers of all ages.
details: A coming-of-age story that explores teenage rebellion, isolation, and disillusionment.

title: The Lord of the Rings
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
reviews: A richly imagined epic that defined the fantasy genre.
Tolkien's world-building and intricate plot are masterful.
details: An epic fantasy adventure following a quest to destroy a powerful ring.

title: Harry Potter and the Sorcerer's Stone
author: J.K. Rowling
reviews: An enchanting start to the beloved Harry Potter series.
Rowling's magical world and relatable characters are captivating.
details: The first book in the Harry Potter series, introducing the magical world of Hogwarts.

title: The Hobbit
author: J.R.R. Tolkien
reviews: A charming and adventurous tale that precedes The Lord of the Rings.
Bilbo Baggins' journey is filled with whimsy and danger.
details: The prelude to The Lord of the Rings, following Bilbo Baggins' quest for treasure.

title: To the Lighthouse
author: Virginia Woolf
reviews: Woolf's stream-of-consciousness narrative style is poetic and introspective.
The novel explores the complexities of human relationships and perceptions.
details: An introspective modernist novel that delves into human emotions, relationships, and perceptions.

title: Moby-Dick
author: Herman Melville
reviews: An epic and symbolic tale of obsession and the human condition.
Melville's prose is immersive and full of literary depth.
details: An adventure novel exploring themes of obsession, revenge, and the human struggle.
